meanings.sent1: The wild field was full of tall, uncropped grass.
meanings.sent2: The uncropped hair of the doll gave it a natural look.
meanings.sent3: The uncropped bushes in the garden looked like a jungle.
meanings.sent4: Her uncropped enthusiasm for life was infectious.
meanings.sent5: The uncropped forest stretched as far as the eye could see.

meanings.definition: Not having the ears or tail cut off
meanings.sent1: The uncropped puppy wagged its long tail happily.
meanings.sent2: The uncropped cat listened intently with its long ears.
meanings.sent3: The uncropped rabbit hopped around the yard, looking adorable.
meanings.sent4: Her uncropped curiosity led her to new discoveries.
meanings.sent5: The uncropped horse flicked its long tail to shoo away flies.

meanings.definition: Not having the top or ends cut off
meanings.sent1: The uncropped photo showed the entire landscape.
meanings.sent2: The uncropped loaf of bread looked rustic and homemade.
meanings.sent3: The uncropped rope dangled down from the tree, waiting to be used.
meanings.sent4: His uncropped story left the listeners hanging in suspense.
meanings.sent5: The uncropped mountain peak reached high into the sky.
